main event: A white fireball with a tail changing from white to blue-green was observed for 14 seconds over Dover AFB, Delaware on October 15, 1959.
interesting points: The fireball was the size of a pea held at arm's length, with a tail that was 1 to 1.25 inches long.
The fireball was observed by the tower chief and another controller at the control tower, which was at an elevation of approximately 80 feet.
The object traversed an arc of 45 degrees from 190 degrees to 145 degrees, at an elevation of just above the tree tops.
The sighting lasted exactly 14 seconds from 2301Z to 2301Z and 59 seconds.
The weather conditions were clear with good visibility, a full moon rising, and temperature inversions at 700-1000 feet and 5000 feet.
sighted object: white fireball with tail changing to blue-green
